definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: The fur was as soft as velvet.
sentences.chinese: 这毛皮有如天鹅绒般软滑。

sentences.english: The world is really foxy woman?
sentences.chinese: 世间也真有如狐般的女子吗？

sentences.english: We all, like a group of no solution of the equation.
sentences.chinese: 我们的一切，有如一组无解的方程。

sentences.english: Resistance to solvent, strong in wet condition and be used as cloth.
sentences.chinese: 抗溶剂，湿强度佳，有如布般的感觉，可重复使用。

sentences.english: The thought fluttered in her mind like a flame-attracted moth .
sentences.chinese: 这想法有如被火光吸引的飞蛾在她心里扑腾着。

sentences.english: Wooing the Granite State is fiendishly hard.
sentences.chinese: 要赢得“花岗岩州”有如过刀山下火海。

sentences.english: When that happens, children have “the guardian angel installed behind the tongue”.
sentences.chinese: 当这些能实现时，孩子们的语言便有如天使护佑。

sentences.english: We are like jewels, shaped with the hammer and chisel of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有如宝石，需要经过苦难的锤凿来雕琢。

sentences.english: Iron sharpeneth iron, so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
sentences.chinese: 朋友互相砥砺，有如以铁锉铁。

sentences.english: Here is a number of breathtaking photographs to inspire you!
sentences.chinese: 下面就是一些慑人心魄的照片，能让你灵感有如泉涌。

sentences.english: Hemingway was as handsome as a film star , Bogart as sophisticated as a writer .
sentences.chinese: 海明威英俊好比影星，而鲍嘉睿智有如作家。

sentences.english: Grace is like a paradise in blessings, and mercy remaineth for ever.
sentences.chinese: 仁爱有如蒙受祝福的花园，慈善永远常存。

sentences.english: The scene takes place in a dream athmosphere where time seems to be suspended.
sentences.chinese: 事件发生的场景有如梦境，时间仿佛停止了。

sentences.english: I walk slowly, like one who comes from so far away he doesn't expect to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 我款款而行，有如来自远方而不存到达希望的人。

sentences.english: In a way, Jesus was like a docent for his disciples in training.
sentences.chinese: 在某一方面来说，耶稣亦有如导赏员一样训练门徒。

sentences.english: Thoughts pass in my mind like swallows of lucks in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 思想掠过我的心上，有如一群野燕飞过天空。

definition: to be as if.../to be rather like...
(literary) to be exactly like/to be exactly as if
